subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|i}}: {{zh-l|*言|word}} with something in {{zh-l|*口|mouth}} – sound comes from the mouth.

{{zh-cat|Intermediate}}

subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanji|grade=1|rs=音00}}

# [[sound]]
# [[timbre]]
# {{short for|lang=ja|音楽|tr=ongaku|nodot=1|sort=おん}}: [[music]]
# [[speech]] {{gl|[[phonetics]]}}
# {{short for|lang=ja|字音|tr=jion|nodot=1}}: [[Chinese]]-derived [[reading]] of a ''[[kanji]]''
# [[news]], [[tiding]]s

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|おん}}

# [[sound]]
# {{lb|ja|linguistics|sort=おん}} [[speech]] [[sound]]
# {{short for|lang=ja|音読み|tr=on'yomi|nodot=1|sort=おん}}: the [[Chinese]]-derived [[reading]] of a ''[[kanji]]''
# {{lb|ja|by extension}} reading of a [[Chinese character]] outside the Japanese language; [[rime]]
# {{short for|lang=ja|音楽|tr=ongaku|nodot=1|sort=おん}}: [[music]]

subSections.title: Derived terms
Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: ''Oto'' is used for loud sounds and voices, as opposed to ''ne'' (see below).

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text:
* {{ja-r|足音|あしおと}}
* {{ja-r|音に聞く|おと に きく}}

subSections.title: Etymology 3
Noun
Derived terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|風の音の|かぜ の と の|pos=pillow word}}

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: ''Ne'' is used for relatively soft sounds and voices that appeals to human emotions, as opposed to ''oto'' (see above).

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 5
Affix
Hanja
subSections.text:
{{ko-hanja|hangeul=음}}

# ([[소리]] 음, ''sori-''): [[sound]]
# ([[소식]] 음, ''sosig-''): [[news]]
# ([[말]] 음, ''mal-''): [[speech]]
# ([[음]] 음, ''[[eum]]-''): [[pronunciation]]
#* [[訓]]之對 [[文字]]讀聲 ([[훈]]지대 [[문자]]독성, ''hunjidae munjadokseong'') the complement of the ''[[hun]]'' (hence) the sound reading a (Chinese) character.

subSections.title: Compounds
Compounds
Usage notes
subSections.text: * Chữ Nôm. The modern Vietnamese equivalent is [[âm]].
